segments.source_content:
---
slug: /135
title: "This Week In React #135: Signals, Sandpack, React doc, Server References, TanStack Start, Next.js, Remix, Hydrogen, Storybook, Expo, TypeScript, rspack..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 02-21-2023
---
Hi everyone!
After a little break, we catch up with 2 weeks of news: a packed edition!

**This Week In React just celebrated its 3rd birthday!** I made a [little thread](https://link.slo.im/3-years) to explain where I am, including links to my "build in public" pages. TLDR: the newsletter is finally viable, with more than **17500 subscribers**, growing fast, and **27kâ‚¬** turnover in 2022. Thanks you for supporting me over the years and making all this possible!

The [Call for Paper](https://conference-hall.io/public/event/5hkuk4Ueg7U9y0uwNRRK) for the [React-Native-Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) conference (June 1st in Paris) is open. Don't hesitate to participate. Travel and 2 nights of hotel are taken care of for the speakers. I am part of the program committee.

zh-hant.reason: URL for a 'link' was changed from 'https://conference-hall.io/public/event/5hkuk4Ueg7U9y0uwNRRK' to 'https://reactnativeconnection.io/'.

segments.source_content: I'm going to change the way I do the [Twitter thread](https://slo.im/thread) for various reasons. In particular, I find that the formality of the thread makes me less authentic and does not spark any interesting discussions. I also feel that the Twitter algorithm is becoming less and less fond of external links and is penalizing me. I will continue to be active on Twitter to share React news with you, but in another form.

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor1}
[![refine](/emails/issues/135/refine.png)](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)
[**refine - 100% open-source, headless React framework for building CRUD apps**](https://github.com/refinedev/refine)

[Check out refine](https://github.com/refinedev/refine) before starting your next admin panel, dashboard or internal tool. You'll be amazed at how much faster you can develop while still remaining flexible!
## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![useSignal() is the Future of Web Frameworks](/emails/issues/135/signals.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/usesignal-is-the-future-of-web-frameworks)
**[`useSignal()` is the Future of Web Frameworks](https://www.builder.io/blog/usesignal-is-the-future-of-web-frameworks)**

Misko is the creator of Qwik and AngularJS. He highlights the interest of signals, and makes a comparison with the way React works. React uses directly the value of the state, while signals use a getter, and create subscriptions when this getter is called.

translations.zh-hant: Miskoï¼ˆQwik å’Œ AngularJS çš„å‰µå»ºè€…ï¼‰å¼·èª¿äº† signals çš„å„ªå‹¢ï¼Œä¸¦èˆ‡ React çš„é‹ä½œæ–¹å¼é€²è¡Œå°æ¯”ã€‚React ç›´æ¥ä½¿ç”¨ç‹€æ…‹å€¼ï¼Œè€Œ signals ä½¿ç”¨ getter æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œä¸¦åœ¨èª¿ç”¨æ™‚å»ºç«‹è¨‚é–±é—œä¿‚ã€‚

segments.source_content: Signals allow for automatic optimization of re-renders with fine granularity, without the need for memoization. Intermediate components that sometimes only do props drilling do not need to re-render.

This article was published the day after the [Angular announcement](https://twitter.com/angular/status/1625939902046117890) that plans to use signals (a [demo](https://twitter.com/sarah_edo/status/1628065696247857152) is now available).

Andrew Clark has [commented](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1626590880126889984) on the potential introduction of signals in React. He prefers for the moment to bet on the [React Forget](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGEMwh32soc) compiler, which we should have news soon via a React Labs article. I think it's a good thing that React is going against the trend and continue to [explore the current direction](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1625599973420154881).

translations.zh-hant: Andrew Clark å·²[è©•è«–](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1626590880126889984)åœ¨ React ä¸­å¼•å…¥ signals çš„æ½›åœ¨å¯èƒ½ã€‚ä»–ç›®å‰å‚¾å‘æŠ¼æ³¨ [React Forget](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lGEMwh32soc) ç·¨è­¯å™¨ï¼Œé è¨ˆå°‡é€é React Labs æ–‡ç« ç™¼å¸ƒé€²å±•ã€‚æˆ‘èªç‚º React é€†å‹¢è€Œè¡Œä¸¦æŒçºŒ[æ¢ç´¢ç¾æœ‰æ–¹å‘](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1625599973420154881)æ˜¯ä»¶å¥½äº‹ã€‚

segments.source_content: [![Announcing Sandpack 2.0 and a Node.js runtime for any browser](/emails/issues/135/sandpack2.jpg)](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)

translations.zh-hant: [![Announcing Sandpack 2.0 and a Node.js runtime for any browser](/emails/issues/135/sandpack2.jpg)](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)

segments.source_content: **[Announcing Sandpack 2.0 and a Node.js runtime for any browser](https://codesandbox.io/blog/announcing-sandpack-2)**

CodeSandbox announced the new version of Sandpack, a tool that allows to create interactive live-coding experiences in the browser (code editor + preview). Sandpack integrates well with React thanks to a dedicated package. The v1 was already used on the new React beta docs site, by Josh Comeau and many others.

translations.zh-hant: CodeSandbox å®£ä½ˆäº† Sandpack çš„æ–°ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œé€™æ˜¯ä¸€å€‹èƒ½åœ¨ç€è¦½å™¨ä¸­å‰µå»ºäº’å‹•å¼å³æ™‚ç·¨ç¢¼é«”é©—çš„å·¥å…·ï¼ˆç¨‹å¼ç¢¼ç·¨è¼¯å™¨ + é è¦½ï¼‰ã€‚Sandpack é€éå°ˆç”¨å¥—ä»¶èˆ‡ React å®Œç¾æ•´åˆã€‚v1 ç‰ˆæœ¬å·²è¢«ç”¨æ–¼æ–°ç‰ˆ React beta æ–‡ä»¶ç¶²ç«™ã€Josh Comeau åŠå…¶ä»–è¨±å¤šå ´æ™¯ã€‚

segments.source_content: This v2 is based on the new NodeBox technology which allows to run Node.js in the browser. It is possible to run Next.js, Vite, Astro and other stacks.

translations.zh-hant: æ­¤ v2 ç‰ˆæœ¬åŸºæ–¼å…¨æ–°çš„ NodeBox æŠ€è¡“ï¼Œå¯åœ¨ç€è¦½å™¨ä¸­é‹è¡Œ Node.jsã€‚èƒ½å¤ é‹è¡Œ Next.jsã€Viteã€Astro ç­‰æŠ€è¡“æ£§ã€‚

segments.source_content: This reminds of StackBlitz's technology, that just [announced the WebContainers API](https://blog.stackblitz.com/posts/webcontainer-api-is-here/). The Sandpack article explains the differences between NodeBox and WebContainers technologies.

**[React.js: The Documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pDqJVdNa44)**
You probably already know that a documentary about React is out ğŸ˜‰ ! I'm putting some cool bonus links:

- ğŸ¥ [Q&A with the cast of React.js: The Documentary](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzRSysq7F4k): Michael Chan asks some interesting questions to the original React team.
- ğŸ“œ [Behind the Scenes with React.js: the Documentary](https://newsletter.pragmaticengineer.com/p/react-documentary): behind-the-scene interview with Ida who created the documentary.
- ğŸ“œ [Adopting React in the Early Days](https://cult.honeypot.io/reads/adopting-react-in-the-early-days/): my outsider's perspective on this period.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ¦ [Andrew Clark - "I'm joining Vercel"](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1623353741750546439). He keeps his role in the React team.
- ğŸ¦ [Netflix using React for its TV UI](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1628391651835011076): we tend to forget it because Netflix doesn't communicate much about their proprietary TV UI technology. Kaleb was supposed to give a talk at React NYC, but the conference was cancelled: he's looking for a new conference, so invite him!
- ğŸ‘€ [React PR - Enable passing Server References from Server to Client](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/26124): an interesting PR that allows client components to call server callbacks, in the current RPC trend.
- ğŸ‘€ [React PR - Suspense for CPU-bound trees](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1628128850377940993): feature that could come soon in a minor version.
- ğŸ‘€ [TanStack Start](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1627740526551175190): new React meta-framework being developed?
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js Route Handlers](https://twitter.com/nextjs/status/1626341664402051072): new Next.js solution to replace routes API?
- ğŸ‘€ [RFC: React Aria Components](https://github.com/adobe/react-spectrum/pull/4058): React Aria wants to offer a slightly higher level layer to facilitate the use of the library.
- ğŸ§µ ["JSX could have been 2x faster if it was designed more optimally for JS VMs!"](https://twitter.com/mhevery/status/1626422858862960648): interesting thread, especially Dan Abramov's response, which nuances the proposition outcomes.
- ğŸ§µ [Dan Abramov - "20â€™s: Composing server and client as one paradigm"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1625225990023655425)
- ğŸ“– [Migrating to Modern Redux](https://redux.js.org/usage/migrating-to-modern-redux): new available doc.
- ğŸ“œ [Hydrogen v2 is Remixed](https://twitter.com/remix_run/status/1623744656701026306): as expected, the Shopify Hydrogen framework moved to Remix. The article lists some benefits. In reality, it's not really a v2: they decided to use a different versioning strategy.
- ğŸ“œ [The Power of Keys in Framer Motion](https://www.nan.fyi/keys-in-framer-motion): great interactive article, explains the interest of using React keys to trigger animations.
- ğŸ“œ [Leveraging Server Context for Advanced Next.js Optimization Patterns](https://prismic.io/blog/advanced-nextjs-server-context): very good article about server context which is still present, but has become more implicit with Server Components. The low level API `AsyncLocalStorage` is useful to deduplicate server requests and create a cache.
- ğŸ“œ [How to handle errors in React](https://www.developerway.com/posts/how-to-handle-errors-in-react): today [I learned a useful fancy technique](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1628340871899893768) to ensure that error boundaries catch all kind of errors, not just those thrown during React render.
- ğŸ“œ [OSS Feature Decision Tree](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/oss-feature-decision-tree): Dominik explains how he decides if a feature will be integrated into React-Query. This reminds me of the [Extensible Web Manifesto](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1627637410438815744).
- ğŸ“œ [The case for frameworks](https://seldo.com/posts/the_case_for_frameworks): answer to Alex Russell, explains why we choose to adopt a rather heavy framework like React despite the negative impact on performance.
- ğŸ“œ [Effective Higher-Order Components](https://www.bbss.dev/posts/effective-hocs/): lists some recommendations and anti-patterns of HOCs, without overselling them. The author likes hooks, but there are still some relevant uses of HOCs.
- ğŸ“œ [Detecting Nested Components in React with the Context API](https://www.aleksandrhovhannisyan.com/blog/react-context-nested-components/): useful context technique to know. To complete: you should not be afraid to use a context provider on several levels, sometimes in order to enrich the value of the context as you go deeper in the tree.
- ğŸ“œ [Improved type safety in Storybook 7](https://storybook.js.org/blog/improved-type-safety-in-storybook-7/): Component Story Format 3 + TypeScript `satisfies` improves the type safety.
- ğŸ“œ [Maximising performance with React code splitting techniques](https://edvins.io/react-code-splitting-techniques)
- ğŸ“œ [Modularizing React Applications with Established UI Patterns](https://martinfowler.com/articles/modularizing-react-apps.html)
- ğŸ“œ [A Historical Reference of React Criticism](https://www.zachleat.com/web/react-criticism/)
- ğŸ“œ [A minimal, multi-framework, responsive image component](https://dev.to/ascorbic/a-minimal-multi-framework-responsive-image-component-3iop)
- ğŸ“œ [Using WebSockets in a Redux Application](https://www.taniarascia.com/websockets-in-redux/)
- ğŸ“œ [How to Integrate GreenSock with Remotion](https://enlear.academy/how-to-integrate-greensock-with-remotion-e4eee6f5a41f)
- ğŸ“œ [What Netlify's Acquisition of Gatsby Really Means](https://remotesynthesis.com/blog/gatsby-plus-netlify/)
- ğŸ¥ [Fireship - 7 better ways to create a React app](https://www.youtube.com/watch?app=desktop&v=2OTq15A5s0Y)
- ğŸ¥ [Killing ReactJS - A Guide For Hopeful Frameworks](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LMUKsAf2Rfs)
- ğŸ“¦ [Remix 1.13](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/releases/tag/remix%401.13.0): Tailwind + PostCSS support
- ğŸ“¦ [MDX 2.3](https://github.com/mdx-js/mdx/releases/tag/2.3.0): new compiler options to support other frameworks than React, relying on other naming conventions (className vs class for example)
- ğŸ“¦ [Unovis - modular data visualization framework for React, Angular, Svelte...](https://unovis.dev/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Redwood 4.1](https://github.com/redwoodjs/redwood/releases/tag/v4.1.0)

## ğŸ’¸ Sponsor {#sponsor2}
[![surveyjs.jpg](/emails/issues/136/surveyjs.jpg)](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)
**[Extensible JavaScript libraries for surveys and forms](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)**

[SurveyJS](https://github.com/surveyjs) is a set of open-source JavaScript form libraries that you can easily integrate into your web app. It lets you **create and run multiple forms**, retaining all sensitive data on your servers, or have **your own self-hosted WYSIWYG form builder** that non-tech users can use directly.

You can also **analyze survey results** in custom-built dashboards, save your forms to PDF, or simply **convert them to editable PDF files**. It offers native support for **React and Angular rendering** and total freedom of choice as to the backend, because **any server + database combination is fully compatible**.

ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ’¼ [**Passionfroot - Senior Full-stack Engineer (Remix) - â‚¬160k+, Berlin/remote**](https://passionfroot.recruitee.com/o/senior-fullstack-engineer)

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!

## ğŸ”€ Other {#other}

- [ts-reset](https://github.com/total-typescript/ts-reset): interesting idea, a kind of CSS reset for TypeScript that patches some annoying TS parts. For example, `.filter(Boolean)` becomes a real type-guard and does not return `undefined` types. Many other methods return `unknown` instead of `any`.
- [rspack](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@rspack/core) + [oxc](https://github.com/Boshen/oxc): ByteDance (TikTok) devs working on Rust alternatives to Webpack/Babel.
- [HOTScript - Higher-Order TypeScript](https://github.com/gvergnaud/hotscript): if you want to do functional programming in the type system, this project is for you ğŸ˜„
- [Web Push for Web Apps on iOS and iPadOS](https://webkit.org/blog/13878/web-push-for-web-apps-on-ios-and-ipados/)

- [Container queries land in stable browsers](https://web.dev/cq-stable/)
- [TypeScript Course - Build a TypeScript Project From Scratch (free)](https://www.typescriptcourse.com/tutorials/build-a-typescript-project-from-scratch)
- [Understanding Monomorphism to Improve Your JS Performance Up to 60x](https://www.builder.io/blog/monomorphic-javascript)
